event.name: OUTCAST_STORIES
event.text: Orbiting the nearby planet is an old Theocracy mining colony, established to harvest materials from the planet's rings. Now, it seems to have been converted into an Outcast camp, where several Rocks and even a few SSLG agents have gathered.

No one pays you any mind as you dock, so it's safe to assume they must be used to visitors. You enter the antechamber, where you find a small atmospheric fire has been lit and residents sit in a circle around one tall, robed Rockman with spears of yellow paint down his arms who looks to be telling stories.

The robed Outcast turns to face you, smiling wide. "Esteemed guests, won't you join us! You're just in time to hear the tales of the Dread Pirate Tuco! Tell me, since you don't seem to be from here, which story would you like to hear?" He presents several options.

choice.text: (Tuco) "Allow me to tell you a story of my own!"
Tell the first tale of Tuco, the Vrachos IV Protests.
Tell the second tale of Tuco, the Kitpak Slave Camps.
Tell the third tale of Tuco, his legacy today.
I'm not familiar with who Tuco is.

event.text: "Ahhh, I see. Tuco is a legend, a hero, but most of all, not just one, but many people. It is a title inherited through honor and circumstance. We Outcasts pay respects to the many Tucos of history, who have always stood in the name of justice, whether that enemy be the fallen Rock-Crystal empire of long ago, or the modern day Theocracy. Now that you know this, would you like to hear one of my stories?"

choice.text: (Tuco) "Allow me to tell you a story of my own!"
Tell the first tale of Tuco, the Vrachos IV Protests.
Tell the second tale of Tuco, the Kitpak Slave Camps.
Tell the third tale of Tuco, his legacy today.
[Federation Database] See what the database says on Tuco.

event.text: The Dread Pirate Tuco, true to what the Outcast claims, is not so much a singular person but rather a title. The original Tuco for which the moniker was derived lived during the days of the archaic Rock-Crystal Empire and fought against Toarde and the other 4 Rock Elders during the collapse of the Empire. While Tuco's side inevitably lost and the Theocracy rose from the ashes of that war, stories of the ventures of Tuco continued to be shared by Rock school-children even after the Elders forbade them from being told. Several Rockmen have picked up the title of Tuco since then, giving the name even more infamy and immortality. The current holder of the title is believed to once have been known as Rowbad, and currently works as a bodyguard for Ocym, the Aquarian co-founder of the Argeonn smuggler clan.

choice.text: (Tuco) "Allow me to tell you a story of my own!"
Tell the first tale of Tuco, the Vrachos IV Protests.
Tell the second tale of Tuco, the Kitpak Slave Camps.
Tell the third tale of Tuco, his legacy today.
We don't have time for stories.

event.text: "A shame. I assure you, they're good ones. If you shall not humor my storytelling, then perhaps you will at least accept a gift? It is customary that we welcome new visitors in such a fashion."

choice.text: We don't have time for stories.

event.text: "A shame. I assure you, they're good ones. If you shall not humor my storytelling, then perhaps you will at least accept a gift? It is customary that we welcome new visitors in such a fashion."

choice.text: We don't have time for stories.

event.text: "A shame. I assure you, they're good ones. If you shall not humor my storytelling, then perhaps you will at least accept a gift? It is customary that we welcome new visitors in such a fashion."

The robed Outcast turns to you, his smile quickly fading. "I see you are not one for stories. You Federation officers, you're always about getting right to the point. What's the point of your journey if you take no time to enjoy it? I will not turn down your request, that would be rude. But I will ask that you leave once your ship has been restocked, so that we may enjoy our night in peace."
These people seem to be enjoying themselves - best not to disturb them.

choice.text: (Scrap Arm) Ignore the colony and salvage some of the asteroids yourself.

event.text: You doubt there's much point in visiting the colony.

event.name: OUTCAST_STORIES_PROTEST
event.text: "An excellent choice." The Outcast stretches out his arms to the crowd as you take a seat, then begins to tell his story. "Not too long ago, on the cusp of the revolution, protestors had begun to gather on Vrachos IV, the homeworlds of the Rock species and capital planet of the Theocracy! Though they started peacefully, Stonewall (the residing Elder and leader of the Inquisitions) would not dare have anyone question himself or the other Elders, and so he dispatched his Crusader forces to handle the crowds."

"Among them was a young Outcast whom today we know as Tuco, a fiery spirit who would not let the Theocracy continue to spit in the face of freedom! Soon, the conflict grew so large that the Paladins from Numa V had to be called, a rare but significant show of force from the Elders. So numerous were the arrests made that it was clear executions would be inefficient, and so the leaders of the protests were killed and the rest exiled. Tuco, with nowhere left to go, journeyed with the countless thousands of other Outcasts to the Badlands, where they founded the first of the Outcast settlements that we live in today."

event.name: OUTCAST_STORIES_SLAVE
event.text: "An excellent choice." The Outcast stretches out his arms to the crowd as you take a seat, then begins to tell his story. "It is no secret that the Tiiikaka slavers are only present in our sectors because they have been employed by the Theocracy to capture our brothers and sisters for use in the Coalition construction yards. Tuco himself was one of the many victims of these raids, and so he was taken to the Tiiikaka camps. But Tuco cared not for chains and cuffs, and so at night he put together a resistance effort to defeat their cruel masters. This is where he adopted his title as Tuco, a codename between resistance coordinators so as not to leak the identities of those involved.

"Tuco and the other escapees overwhelmed the slavers and escaped by stealing a Hephaestus-built vessel. Tuco gained infamy among pirates and Theocracy citizens alike. He returned to the Badlands, and together with the forces of Admiral Ariadne of the Lost Sun fleet drove Tiiikaka from the Badlands once again. Tuco stayed with us Outcasts for some time until he grew restless, and once again departed to seek greater adventures in the starry beyond!"

event.name: OUTCAST_STORIES_LEGACY
event.text: "An excellent choice." The Outcast stretches out his arms to the crowd as you take a seat, then begins to tell his story. "After rescuing the Badlands from Tiiikaka forces, Tuco grew restless living in the Badlands. A life of quiet complacency within the Theocracy, and months trapped in a filthy cell in a Tiiikaka slave camp had filled him with a deep yearning for adventure. Fear not, for the great Tuco lives on to this day! They say he works a position of protection for Ocym, founder of Argeonn! Tuco has not abandoned us yet brothers and sisters - never fear. Before he left, he made a promise that should the Badlands ever be under threat again, we only need to call him back and he will come."

You didn't even realize it, but time slipped away from you faster than you thought. With the story over, you apologize but explain you have to leave. "I understand the importance of your mission, and won't keep you any longer. But I speak for everyone when I say that I appreciated your company with us today. It is not often we get visitors, much less ones so interested in tales of our history. Please, accept this gift."

event.name: OUTCAST_STORIES_TUCO_BLUE
event.text:
"Can it be true? To hear a new story of the Dread Pirate... it is an honor!"
Tuco takes out a stringed instrument. "Feel free to join along. Personally, I say any story should have a proper soundtrack, you hear?" The other Rocks nod as they start to take out instruments of their own - percussion, horns, wind.
"Any thoughts on a track we could play?" The other storyteller asks.
"I was thinkin', something similar to 'The Rupture of Delta Gorno'? Sound good?" The others nod their heads in agreement. "One, two, three, four." The rocks begin to play their instruments, and the SSLG clap along. "My friends, the Hive, she knows no depth to her voracious appetite. That queen, those insects... they'll fight for anything they can get their sharp little legs on, and stab anyone they need to keep it. Many 'a Rock has become one of their slaves toiling away in the mines of Viiikaliraaako. Anyone?"
"A sister." One of the Rocks working a bongo mutters gruffly.
"A sister. Being forced to create wealth for a tyrannical queen bug. Oh, the wealth of those awful mines. And does the Hive deserve a smidgen of it?"
"No!!"
"No! Of course not, so I'll tell you what I did. Me and my crew, we took my good ol' dusty cruiser and I thought I'd teach 'em a lesson. Once a week, they load up all that filthy lucre into a convoy and send it back to their nest. Well, I'm no stranger to a risky strategy, so I'll tell you what I did. My friends had come into possession of a fancy Union transport. All we had to do was make them think it was full of useful and talented slaves. Once they had come within a jump of it, we activated its distress call and waited. Like clockwork, two of the Suzerains peeled off to investigate. Right into the minefield we'd left for them. That left only two of them versus my one, single ship. But you all know me, that's more than a fair fight as far as I'm concerned! We fended off those Mantises, two to one! The battle was glorious... and the treasure was all ours!"
"What did you do with the bounty?"
Tuco stops strumming. "Well... gambling and drinking, mostly." The crowd gives a raucous laughter.
"That's our Tuco!"

You didn't even realize it, but time slipped away from you faster than you thought. With the story over, you apologize but explain you have to leave. "We are sorry for holding you up so much, but it was a great honor to meet with a living legend. We will sing songs of your tales too, once you are victorious. Go win your fight, Renegade!"

event.name: OUTCAST_RECRUITMENT
event.text: You're startled by the presence of a Lost Sun outpost nearby, but you quickly realize it's nothing malicious. A few patrol ships orbit the outpost, broadcasting messages to nearby vessels advertising a recruitment campaign for the Suns.
As you step aboard the Lost Sun station, several security guards run over but relax once they realize you're with the Federation.

choice.text: (Outcast Crew) Pay to use their training facilities to convert your outcast into a commando.

event.text: The commander of the outpost thinks it over for a moment but eventually agrees.

Your Rockman storms to the comms, unleashing a series of violent slurs against the Lost Suns and all of their members. As any rational person would expect... this does not go over well with them at all.

Fortunately for you, it seems the recruitment center doubles as a supply depot for Lost Sun ships passing through. With your crew's aid you easily get through security and receive some supplies and repairs.

Fortunately for you, it seems the recruitment center doubles as a supply depot for Lost Sun ships passing through. With Ariadne's aid you easily get through security and receive some supplies and repairs.
Maybe there's a reason to justify this violence - but you can ponder that later. Time to murder!
You have no business dealing with these revolutionaries.

event.name: OUTCAST_SHIELD
event.text: The nearby moon appears to have a small village of Outcasts enclosed by a protective shield. Surely that thing must take a lot of power to keep running, and other than the shield it seems they don't have much other means of protection.
The villagers are more than willing to provide you with supplies. It's not a lot, but it's still free.

choice.text: Attack the village to try and access the shield's powersource.
(Upg. Weapons) Fire everything you have on the shield.

event.text: Your arsenal is more than enough to break through the defenses, and several shots even strike the buildings within. The Outcasts begin to evacuate immediately, allowing you enough time to land and secure the power source.
This should allow your reactor to run at even higher capacity than before!

choice.text: Install it into your own shield system.

event.text: This should allow your shields to run at even higher capacity than before!
With no need for any upgrades, you simply convert the power source into fuel for the next several jumps.

choice.text: (Bypass + Teleporter) Send your crew in through the shield.

event.text: Your crew beam through the shields and raise their weapons. You expect some kind of resistance, but the Outcasts seem more interested in avoiding your crew. You storm the center of the village and secure the power source.
This should allow your reactor to run at even higher capacity than before!

choice.text: Install it into your own shield system.

With no need for any upgrades, you simply convert the power source into fuel for the next several jumps.
You have no reason to go around disturbing these people.
You fire as much as you can onto the village, but the shield is stronger than you expected. Your attacks result in nothing but your own embarassment as the Outcasts watch you in bemusement.

Your attack manages to keep the shield down long enough that the Outcasts are sent into panic and surrender. You aren't certain if you would be able to actually get through the shield entirely, so you settle for accepting their surrender instead.

Fortunately, powerful as the shield may be, a few lucky shots from your attack manage to break through and strike the buildings within. The Outcasts begin to evacuate immediately, allowing you enough time to land and secure the power source.
This should allow your reactor to run at even higher capacity than before!

event.name: OUTCAST_PROPAGANDA
event.text: A broadcast station established by the SSLG has been constructed near the beacon, just close enough for its propaganda to reach new arrivals. "The era of the Theocracy is over! Rock brothers, put down your holy texts and join us Crystals in our open arms! Welcome the approaching days of the mighty Rock-Crystal Empire once more! Neither the Lost Suns nor the Federation will show you the way, only we can guide you!"

choice.text: Hail and request to use the broadcast to your benefit.
(Crystal Crew) Convince them to aid you.

event.text: It's tough breaking through the stubborn nature of a Crystal but you manage to convince them to periodically broadcast lies about your location.

You take control over the station's signal and replace it with an announcement of your own ship's arrival - at a very different location. The Crystals take notice and aren't pleased, but hopefully by the time they fix it the Rebels will have caught the word.

You deploy a malicious virus into the station's systems that will periodically replace the broadcast with an announcement of your own ship's arrival - at a very different location. The Crystals shouldn't take notice for a while so hopefully the Rebels will catch the word.

choice.text: Propaganda of any kind is bad. We have to take down the station.

event.text: The Theocracy is vile, yes, but these defamatory lies will only damage the reputation of the Federation with the Outcasts. We can't let these lies be spread!
This propaganda might make some unfavorable accusations about the Federation, but at least it isn't calling the Outcasts to arms against you. Better not to get involved with the SSLG.
It's tough breaking through the stubborn nature of a Crystal but you manage to convince them to periodically broadcast lies about your location.

The Crystals merely laugh in your face at such a proposition. "This might be what YOU desire, but it is not what WE desire. We want the Rebels out of here as soon as possible, and the longer they spend looking for you, the longer we have to deal with them."
The Crystal looks down at the scrap then instinctively scoops it up. "Perhaps our interests do align after all..."

event.name: OUTCAST_VICTIM
event.text: A small Outcast village appears to be under occupation by slavers, who have chained up several Rockmen but are firing at a band of Outcasts who seemed to have escaped.

You land nearby and walk towards them, when the slavers suddenly drop their weapons and their leader falls to his knees and pleads before you. "Ooooh great Federation Captain you have come to save us from these cruel brutes! They have killed my men and I had no choice but to slaughter their families! It was only self defense! I have restrained them here so they can kill no one else! Please oh please, will you help us arrest these evil men and women?" You look at the Outcasts at the other end of the town who merely shrug.
These guys aren't fooling anyone. When the slavers see their "clever trick" has failed they scramble for their guns and prepare to fight you.
It's pretty obvious the slavers are lying but that doesn't mean you can't take advantage of the situation. You prepare to fight off the remaining Outcast survivors.
It's not worth the effort coming between the outcasts and Tiiikaka.

event.name: OUTCAST_SLAVERS_WIN
event.text: "Thank you captain. For a moment I feared you might actually side with the slavers. You have all of our thanks."

event.name: OUTCAST_OUTCAST_WIN
event.text: "See, I knew you'd follow through in the name of justice! Hooray for the Federation! Three cheers!" The slaver looks around but sees no one is clapping and gives up. "Alright whatever. Take a slave or something, I dunno."

event.name: OUTCAST_TEAMWORK
event.text: As soon as you catch sight of the ship at this beacon you regret coming here. Looks like the Coalition has penetrated into this territory. You promptly receive a hail from the ship.

The captain of the vessel, a Slug dressed in a cheap lab coat, appears on the screen. "Now, I know thisss iss unconventional, but the Coalition can wait. I am on a quessst... for SSSSCIENCE! Sssspeccifically, I wisssh to underssstand what about the Outcassstsss grantsss them sssuch amplified abilitiesss in the pressssence of each other. My own crew is not ssso willing to asssissst me, the lazy bassstardsss, so I requessst you go and obtain a few bodiesss from the nearby Outcassst colony. For pay, of courssse. No one doesss ssshit for free anymore."

Following the directions from the Coalition vessel, you're guided to a small Outcast colony with a few ships docked. Wasting no time, you power up your weapons and engage! No need to target the crew - even after an explosion the resilient bodies of Rockmen will stay intact.
"Wow, even money couldn't coax you greedy bassstardsss into doing sssomething? What hassss the world come to... Oh well, guessss I have to kill you now."

The Slug's eyestalks curl inwards, a sign of annoyance and bemusement. "What'sss ssso funny? I didn't know the sssentient bowling ballsss had a sssenssse of humor."
Alkali tries to snarl but he's too caught up in laughing. "Oh... it's just thhhat... heh... you're so cute in your little lab coat... a Slug scientist? Oh how your species cracks me up. Slugs know nothhhing of science. On thhhe evolutionary ladder, all thhhe scientific understanding and thhhe dignity to use it went to us Shells. But I don't want to ruin your fun; so go on, carry on your little experiments thhhen." Alkali imitates patting the Slug on the head. The Slug growls and says nothing more apart from ordering his crew to attack.
"Uhhh, what the hell did you jussst sssay to me? Uegh, humansss and their ssstupid cheesssy phrasssess. What doess that have to do with anything anywaysss?"

choice.text: Outcasts get their abilities from teamwork.

event.text: "What? Teamwork? I've heard of that, but I have yet to identify the genome. Issss that ssome kind of genetic trait ssshared by Outcassstss? I ssshall resssearch thisss further. Thissss hass been a massssive help."
There's no way you're risking falling into a trap from the Coalition. Arm the weapons!

event.name: OUTCAST_ANNOYING
event.text: An outcast vessel is approaching, their captain wearing a bright yellow leotard and carrying a harp in his hand. "Halt, Federation! I hath taken a noble voyage to the lands of the Dynasty and learned from the finest of poets the art of story telling. I demand thee listen to mine tale, or I shall come and squish your puny skull between my thighs!"

The Rockman strums his harp, then begins to speak in a strange accent. "My story begins with darkness and a scream, as my infantile body exits the womb of my mother. How I cried! How she cried! We all cried! I think! I don't really know, I was just born. I'm just guessing. People normally cry after childbirth, I think."

The outcast isn't off to a great start, but it only gets worse. He takes you through all of the experiences of his early, teenaged, and adult life. He complains of old girlfriends, bad teachers, idiotic co-workers, some weird story about eating one of the statues outside of his church, how he became vegetarian after visiting the Orchids, an affair with a Separatist, and some other even more outlandish stories you're certain are fake.

Somehow, the poet continues all the way past the current day and onto the lives of his children. Most of your crew have already fallen asleep but somehow, by some miracle, the poet finally finishes his story. "I do hope thou enjoyed it! I'll be publishing the written work and even an audiobook soon! Rate it 5 stars if thou liked it! I'm not really sure what else to say!" There's a few moments of awkward silence, but the outcast transfers over some scrap and a weapon as 'thanks' and to help 'encourage' you to promote him to your friends.
No way you're wasting even more time listening to this weirdo and his life story. Better fight your way out!

choice.text: Stop him and try to leave.

event.text: No way you're wasting even more time listening to this weirdo and his life story. Better fight your way out!

choice.text: Sounds like his story is a long one. We better fight through this.

event.text: No way you're wasting time listening to this weirdo and his life story. Better fight your way out!

event.name: OUTCAST_CHUNGUS
event.text: A crowd of ships have gathered around a large battleship with a floating sign besides it that reads "Come see the one and only Chung Bungalung, the Rockman who lived!" Excited chatter takes place between the different ships, sharing tales of Chung's seemingly impossible escape from the clutches of the Theocracy.

You're annoyed about having to pay to enter, but it's cheap enough. Inside, you see several paintings of a Rockman so overweight that his head has merged with his torso, and a commemorative set of souvenirs of replica bullet casings. A repurposed Anti-Personnel drone greets you. "Welcome to the esteemed home of Mr. Chung Bungalung, the Rockman who Lived!"
The drone guides you to a new room where you find none other than Chung Bungalung himself. "A Renegade?! Wasn't expecting Feds to come here. Greetings! I am Chung Bungalung, the Rockman who Lived!"

choice.text: Yeah, I've heard. Why do they call you that anyways?

event.text: "Well, you see, it's illegal in the Theocracy to offend a Rock Priest by being ugly, and ugly I very much am! I was sentenced to death, but it takes more than a bullet to stop Chung Bungalung, the Rockman who Lived! They shot me not once, not twice, but five times! Eventually, they gave up and simply dumped me out here! I've become a living legend amongst the Outcasts. And, if you can best me in a duel, then I'll even tell you my secret on how I survived the bullets!"
"Haha, now that's what I like to hear. Commence the battle!"
"Disappointing! Oh well then, I understand. But you'll never learn my secret, haha!"
This all seems like some kind of scam or tourist trap. Not that those are mutually exclusive - no point in stopping here.

event.name: OUTCAST_CHUNGUS_WIN
event.text: "Congratulations, you have bested me! My secret is yours!" Chung powers down his weapons.
Chung leans forward and whispers in your ear; "My secret, is this... my girth."

"HAHAHAH! MY GIRTH! Those dumbasses couldn't penetrate my skull because it was protected by layers upon layers of fat. Now, for being such a good sport and being the first to ever best me in combat, have this!"
"Wait, wait- what are you doing?!"

event.name: OUTCAST_CHUNGUS_LOSE
event.text: "It seems you have lost this battle! Alas, you shall not learn my secret. Apologies, captain!"

event.name: OUTCAST_MAKESHIFT
event.text: A small makeshift Tiiikaka outpost has been constructed nearby for holding slaves. Judging from the fact they don't hail you, it's pretty clear they aren't open to trading.
Even if they were open to selling to you, you wouldn't care. Slavery is immoral, and you're going to free these people.

choice.text: (Teleporter) Beam in a crew member to try and liberate some slaves.
(Upg. Teleporter) Beam in a crew member to try and liberate some slaves.

event.text: Your crew beams into the camp and managed to free several of the slaves being kept there. Your crew and the slaves beam back immediately before the slavers can catch them and you slip away undetected.
Slavers are known to be dangerous, especially when you threaten their 'cargo'. Better not enter their space.
Your crew beams into the camp and managed to free several of the slaves being kept there.
However, on their way back to the ship the slavers catch them and open fire! Your crew is shot, but the slaves manage to make it back to the ship alive. A noble sacrifice.

removeCrew.text: Fortunately the Clone Bay is able to revive your crew, and they are welcomed back with cheers from the now liberated slaves.

event.text: Your crew beams into the camp and managed to free several of the slaves being kept there. However, on their way back to the ship the slavers catch them and open fire! It's a struggle and several of the slaves die, but you're able to repel the slavers long enough to make it back to the ship with your crew still alive.

event.name: DISTRESS_OUTCAST_TENSIONS
event.text: One of the Outcasts' signature ramshackle villages has been constructed aboard an old mining platform, abandoned after the diminished density of nearby asteroid fields. Seems they have a request for you.

"Please, you must help us! The SSLG and Lost Suns are in a constant feud, and it is driving us mad! Now, they've come concerningly close to our village, and if a conflict breaks out we will be caught in the middle! Could you please defuse the tensions between them before it escalates? We'll pay you in advance - we trust you to do the right thing."

You travel not too much further until you find a standoff between two vessels. Their captains are currently engaged in a furious shouting match, calling each other creative insults such as "Son of a faux stone" and "Sediment for brains". No kidding when they said it was heated.
You open fire on the Crystals, and like cowards the Lost Sun ship jumps away. Disappointing, but at least you'll be able to reap the rewards from this fight.
You open fire on the Rockmen, and like cowards the SSLG ship jumps away. Disappointing, but at least you'll be able to reap the rewards from this fight.

choice.text: (Mind Control) Convince them to calm down.

event.text: Only able to mind control one of the two, you choose the Crystals as they're known to be more stubborn. The sudden switch in the Crystal's tone confuses the Rockman, but he isn't going to let up. Eventually you just give up and tell the two to cut it out and they seem to finally give up. Though the Outcasts paid you already, they're so impressed by you being able to end the conflict without any bloodshed they offer a second reward.
You apologize but explain you are not the right person for this.

Both the Crystal and the Rockman turn to you in confusion, and you try to explain your point to them. However, seems it's too late as the two have already mutually muted you and gone back to shouting. Seems this won't work.
You open fire on the Crystals, and like cowards the Lost Sun ship jumps away. Disappointing, but at least you'll be able to reap the rewards from this fight.
You open fire on the Rockmen, and like cowards the SSLG ship jumps away. Disappointing, but at least you'll be able to reap the rewards from this fight.

You try and convince the two to stop their arguing. They won't listen, so you divert your efforts to convincing them to go elsewhere. This works, and though the Outcasts paid you already, they're so impressed by you being able to end the conflict without any bloodshed they offer a second reward.

event.name: DISTRESS_OUTCAST_LOSTCARGO
event.text: A group of Theocracy vessels have gathered together near the beacon. They're concerningly well armed and protected, but they barely pay any attention to your presence.

choice.text: Hail and ask about the distress beacon.

event.text: A rather annoyed Rockman responds, seemingly not at all grateful for your quick response to their distress call. "We were tasked with transporting military supplies to a Theocracy outpost at the end of this sector, but a SSLG squadron raided our convoy. If you can assist us in recovering it, we will give you the leftover supplies."

choice.text: Accept their request and inquire about coords.

event.text: The Rockman grunts and grants you access to the coords broadcast by a tracking chip on the stolen cargo.
"Fine, then stop bothering us." The Rockman hangs up.
You've decided to engage the Rockmen.
You aren't sure who these Rocks are hoping to get help from, but it certainly isn't you.

event.name: OUTCAST_LOSTCARGO_QUEST

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: Location of the SSLG station in possession of the Theocracy cargo.

event.text: As you approach the beacon, the tracker chip's signal lets out a beep of confirmation and goes silent. This must be the right place; you can see a couple SSLG ships docked with a small green station.

choice.text: Attack the station for the cargo.

event.text: You've decided to attack the SSLG to get the cargo! Prepare for battle.
The Crystals are both terrified and furious. "Do you have any idea what you're doing? The Theocracy aren't your allies! They'll stab you in the back the first chance they get! Don't do this!"

choice.text: Ignore them and demand they hand over the cargo.

event.text: With no other choice, the Crystals hand over the cargo and jump away. Not too long after the Theocracy convoy arrives and inspects the cargo. Satisfied, they transfer over a reward, but as you're leaving, explosives shake your ship! Seems the SSLG was right about you being stabbed in the back.

choice.text: Propose setting a trap with the cargo.

event.text: The Crystals seem to think this proposition over, but eventually accept. They swap the valuable items inside for explosives.

They thank you one last time and offer a gift before jumping away. Moments later the Theocracy convoy arrives, but as soon as you hand over the cargo it explodes! It mortally wounds the leaders of the Crusaders and cripples their systems. With no other choice, the Theocracy flees.
On a second thought, maybe helping the Theocracy isn't in your best interest. You turn the ship around and fly away.

event.name: QUEST_SSLG_MISTAKE
event.text: "Renegade! Normally I would not go out of my way to interact with your kind, but I have made a dreadful mistake! I had received some intel on the location of a Rockman settlement. I told our ship to go out and liberate it from the Theocracy, but it seems that I have jumped to conclusions. It was actually an Outcast settlement, not a Theocracy one. Please, you have to contact my people before it is too late! You have to tell them to protect the settlement, not attack it."
The Crystal looks relieved. "I'll send you the coordinates. Please, you have to hurry before tragedy strikes!"
"I should have trusted my instincts to not rely upon your kind! Begone, Renegade filth."

event.name: QUEST_SSLG_DESTINATION

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: Location of a misguided SSLG operative.

event.text: A SSLG ship hangs above the orbit of a planet. They look like they are preparing for battle. "This does not concern you, Renegade."

choice.text: Inform the SSLG that the settlement is actually owned by the Theocracy.

event.text: "You must think we are truly stupid to believe we do not already know that. Why do you think we have come here? Now leave us be. We must break the Theocracy's hold on this sector."

choice.text: There is nothing more to do here.
Inform the SSLG that the settlement is actually owned by the Outcasts.

event.text: "You are trying to trick us! You cannot expect us to believe that you are right and we are wrong. Show us some proof, or be destroyed for your treachery."

choice.text: (Adv. Sensors) Present them an accurate reading of the settlement.
(Long-Ranged Scanners) Present them an accurate reading of the settlement.
(Crystal Crew) Tell them about the mistake.

event.text: "I asked for proof! You offer only hearsay. You will pay for your lies!"

triggeredEventBox.tooltip: If you can keep them busy, you can potentially wait for someone else to clear up the confusion!

event.text: You're not interested in talking sense into them. Violence is the quicker solution.

triggeredEventBox.tooltip: If you can keep them busy, you can potentially wait for someone else to clear up the confusion!

event.text: Despite their threat, the SSLG ship makes no attempt to follow you.

event.name: SSLG_MISTAKE_HAIL
event.text: An outcast ship enters the vicinity. The SSLG ship momentarily breaks off its assault in order to hail the Outcast vessel. They sheepishly hail you back afterwards.

event.name: SSLG_MISTAKE_CORRECTED
event.text: "So it is true? To think that we almost committed the exact crime we are trying to stop... Thank you, Renegade. I have misjudged you." The settlement and the ship offer a tribute for settling the situation.

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_OUTCAST
textList.text: When Rockmen go against the Elders, there is not much left for them to become other than outcast pirates or refugees without a future. One such ship patrols the nearby system, and upon spotting you decide your ship would make an excellent target for them!
A ship full of Rock outcasts sees you first. Apparently they are no longer satisfied with the condition of their vessel, because now they're looking to take yours instead.
Outcasts are refugees from the Rock Government. Now forced to live the life of a pirate, they have no choice but to prey on ships such as yours to survive.

event.name: ENCOUNTER_OUTCAST_SUN
event.text: Much like Rocks anywhere else in the galaxy, the Outcasts don't seem to show much regard to the threat of solar flares. You however, do, but the ship nearby spots your unusual movement and suspects you of foul play!

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_SSLG
textList.text: The SSLG's agents have little beef with the Federation, but they've always been suspicious that it might try to intervene with their movement. One overly cautious ship nearby spots you and isn't taking any chances!

You catch radio chatter on a nearby SSLG ship and an unseen outpost some distance away. "By the glory of Dianesh, it's so damn boring here. We're supposed to be overthrowing brutal dictators, not sitting on our asses singing kumbaya with a bunch of hippies! Er, hold on. Someone's watching me... oh what the hell, I'll just go kill them and say they were a spy. Finally something to do!"

"Hey, you! You aren't meant to be here! This sector is under occupation of the SSLG!" Last time you checked, the SSLG has as little authority here as you do, but looks like these guys are intent on beating you up. Get ready for combat!

event.name: OUTCAST_ASTEROID_SLAVER
event.text: Seems nowhere is safe from the influence of Tiiikaka, including this beacon. As you enter the asteroid field, you spot a slaver vessel on the prowl for Outcasts. However, they spot you at the same time and attack, not risking you blowing their cover!

event.name: RUWEN_ENCOUNTER
event.text: A strange, yellow colored Crystal vessel is flying nearby, clearly the origin of the distress call. Despite this, the ship is very well protected and in seemingly no duress.

On your screen appears a lavishly dressed Crystal painted gold sitting aboard a jagged command chair chiseled out of citrine. "Ah, so someone has finally responded. You foreigners are quite... erm... nevermind. Salutations! I am Sir Ruwen Argote, standing Foreign Ambassador of the Great Crystalline Empire. I have been sent here by her majesty Empress Dianesh Kryel. Quite a mouthful of names, yes? I understand you foreigners just love to share your names with all that you meet. Strange, strange... oh, but please take no offense!"

"Wonderful! If you wish you can just call me Ruwen. That is my name, after all. You foreigners do call each other by your first names, right? It gets so confusing with all these 'misters' and 'misses' and 'doctors' and what not."

"Ohoho! A fine joke! I... I think that is a joke. You can never really be quite sure with you aliens. OH. Oh my, I am sorry. I understand foreigners do not like it when we address you as... erm... the 'a-word'. My apologies. I've been so rather clumsy, but old habits die hard!"
Clearly no one here was under serious distress, and so there's no point in sticking around.

event.name: RUWEN_ENCOUNTER_MISSION
event.text: Ruwen glances at his forearm where an ornate digital watch sits upon his wrist and projects the time into the air. "Erm, yes, sorry. Ycathine's crypt knows, I've gotten carried away with my ramblings again. Where was I? Oh, yes. I have been sent here by Empress Dianesh on an important diplomatic mission to recover a sacred object! Very boring political stuff, you wouldn't care much about it. But what you might care about is a job offer! I am in need of an escort. As you can see, my ship is very poorly armed. I require a ship that is... hum, how to put it... ready to put the fecal matter back up the rectums of those who stand in its path? I think that is how you foreigners say it?"

"Good, because I do like saying that one! I will use it more often. Anyways, you look like an expert fecal-matter-putter-upper. With a small downpayment now and larger reward upon arrival, I request you help deliver me and my crew to an arranged meeting with the Lost Sun Admiral. As long as it's not too much of a burden for you, that is!"

"Truly wonderful! You foreigners are so kind! I wish my people acted in such manners, but we keep to ourselves so often I think many of us have forgotten what generosity even means. But that's besides the matter. I've sent the coordinates, just clear the path and we'll be right behind you! Try not to commit too many warcrimes in our presense, heh! But no really, please don't commit any warcrimes."

"Oh, terribly disappointing. Never matter, I understand! You foreigners come and go, always busy busy! Well, I'll be here then, waiting I suppose. Idi Tukala! Erm, sorry. That's... that's goodbye in my native language. Apologies."

event.name: RUWEN_DESTINATION

beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: You've arrived at the destination Ruwen provided you with. Moments later, the Crystal arrives, jubilant as ever. "We meet again! You have my thanks, captain! As promised, your reward. Now, if you don't mind, I must hurry to my meeting. Idi Tukala! Erm, sorry. That's... that's goodbye in my native language. Apologies."

choice.text: Stay and watch the meeting from a distance covertly.

event.text: You watch as Ruwen approaches a strangely colored Rock vessel. Seems to be a Paladin, a very rare and dangerous segment of the Inquisition usually tasked with protecting important clergy members. Based on the conversation you're eavesdropping in on, Ruwen seems equally confused. "Oh erm... pardon me. I was expecting Admiral Ariadne's envoy to be here. I don't believe I had any business with the Theocracy today!"

The fully armored Rockman barely moves as he speaks to Ruwen, his voice bitter. "The traitors whom you were sent to negotiate with have been apprehended by the Theocracy. The Lost Suns are criminals, and it reflects poorly on your Empire when you come into Theocracy territory and begin to make talks of peace with enemies of the Elders. There shall be harsh consequences for these actions."

Ruwen gulps nervously, and shifts uncomfortably in his crystalline chair. "Hahah, surely you're joking! Yes, the Lost Suns are your enemies, but it is not as though the Empire is looking to draw arms against the Elders! We merely wish to settle this ongoing feud between the SSLG and Lost Sun forces for occupancies of the Badlands! That is all. No need for hostility."

The Rockman squints, his gaze focused firmly on Ruwen. "Do not lie to me. We have already interrogated the criminals for the reason of your meeting. You wish to assist them in their attack on Numa V - in return to gaining access to the waystone device that you wish to rob from us. These are acts of war. The Theocracy might be involved in many other conflicts at this moment, but do not think we will take kindly to such insults." Suddenly, weapons spring from the hull of the Rock ship! They're going to attack Ruwen!
You won't stand for this. You raise your weapons and engage the Paladin ship.
It's cruel, but this was the Empire's blunder, not yours. You can't risk angering the Theocracy like this.
Eventually Ruwen leaves your sight as he passes behind a distant moon.

event.name: RUWEN_SAVE
event.text: The Paladin vessel has been defeated. A substantial amount of scrap remains behind to take.

It seems Ruwen's substantial defenses protected him from any major damage during the fight. Still, he's quite shaken. "By the Empress, oh dear. Had it not been for you, I doubt I would still be standing here. It would be against tradition for me to not extend an even greater reward as thanks to you and the Federation. Though my initial diplomatic mission here has failed, perhaps we have achieved new ground instead!"

"Now, erm, it seems there's little point in keeping past pretenses so let me begin again. I needn't waste your time with much historical mumble, but in short the Empire has been so tolerant of the SSLG's more radical motions as the Empress sees great benefit in gaining access to Theocracy grounds. We seek access to the Waystone, the device originally used to seal our homeworlds away from the galaxy. At first, we hoped the Lost Suns might retrieve it for us in return for more dedicated support. But now it seems those plans have faltered. Now, I must go at it alone. It will be perilous, but I wonder if you might be up for the task?"

choice.text: Agree to escort Ruwen to the Crystalline Origins.

event.text: "Most wonderful! Then, with haste we must go! There isn't a second to lose!"

choice.text: Give me a moment to prepare.

event.text: "Ah, no bother then. You've done quite enough. Now, hopefully for the final time, Idi Tukala! Best of luck with your journeys."

event.name: RUWEN_JUMP
event.text: "Are you ready to depart, captain?"

choice.text: Agree to escort Ruwen to the Crystalline Origins.

event.text: "Most wonderful! Then, with haste we must go! There isn't a second to lose!"

choice.text: Give me a moment to prepare.

event.text: "Ah, no bother then. You've done quite enough. Now, hopefully for the final time, Idi Tukala! Best of luck with your journeys."

event.name: TURBAN
event.text: Before you is a grand spectacle, a giant sprawling city so tall it blocks out the sun. Massive bridges span artificial ravines with walls lined with store fronts. Half of the city seems to resemble traditional Rock architecture, but many connected segments are only half complete and are seemingly cobbled together out of scrap metal. This is Turban, one of the largest centers for trade, commerce, and culture in the modern galaxy, created quite ironically from the former site of a Chrysolic Church and Inquisition stronghold.

beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: You fly through the city, taking in truly just how massive it is, compared to all of the much smaller Outcast villages you've seen. As a newcomer and a Renegade you are welcomed warmly, and your time in the city is a pleasant one. You meet a humble Aquarian fisherman who convinces you to try a sample of some exotic octopus, an exceptionally elderly Orchid Caretaker whom crafts dreamcatchers from his own twigs, and even share an awkward encounter with a very drunken ex-Rebel who claims to be Admiral Vance's long lost brother, who buys you 3 rounds of drinks before passing out. You also find a number of stores selling military supplies with an incredible variety of items to choose from.

As a newcomer and a Renegade you are welcomed warmly, and your time in the city is a pleasant one. You meet a humble Aquarian fisherman who convinces you to try a sample of some exotic octopus, an exceptionally elderly Orchid Caretaker whom crafts dreamcatchers from his own twigs, and even share an awkward encounter with a very drunken ex-Rebel who claims to be Admiral Vance's long lost brother, who buys you 3 rounds of drinks before passing out. You also find a number of stores selling military supplies with an incredible variety of items to choose from.

choice.text: We don't need to stop here.

event.text: To many this place would be worth visiting for the sights alone, but to you it's nothing but another store, and you don't need to go shopping right now.

event.name: TURBAN_BOMBING
event.text: As you begin to leave, you catch sight of a shooting star in the sky. Quite strange, considering it's not night time... Then it dawns on you what this is, just in time for you to take cover as a missile barrage strikes one of the nearby towers and sends it crashing down. The attack is followed by a flurry of more missile strikes as Theocracy and Coalition Bombers begin to jump in. The city is under attack!

choice.text: Get back to your ship and flee as soon as possible.

event.text: You take off at once, but you aren't fast enough to escape unharmed. A missile strikes your engines, damaging them badly, while a Coalition Elite spots you and engages!

choice.text: Stay and try to aid the other civilians.

event.text: You came here to save the Federation, but what good is that if you abandon everyone else on your path in doing so? You help pull several civilians out from beneath collapsed debris, but after a missile strike almost costs you your life, you realize if you stay on the surface any longer you'll die. Fortunately, a strangely dressed Rockman in worn priest clothing motions for you to follow him. "Come with me, quickly! We must get to the sewers, we'll be safe from the bombardement there."

You trek through the sewers in silence with your crew, following the Rockman and his lantern through the labyrinth beneath the streets. Eventually, he breaks the silence. "You are noble to stay and help these people. There are few who would. Come, not much further now until we reach the sanctuary." True to his word, only a few turns later and you arrive at a crudely constructed door which you slide out of the way. A repugnant smell assaults your senses but you stifle the urge to gag and take a seat next to a sleeping outcast.

The people in the room pay you little attention, but your companion draws many nasty looks. "Turns out you are a bad omen, Argo. We were warned of your curse, and now look where we are. We should never have given you asylum", spits a young female Mantis with a blood-soaked bandana over her left eye. This insult is met by murmurs of agreement by the rest of the room, who turn their backs to Argo. In defeat, he stumbles over to where you are.

choice.text: Why is everyone mad at you?

event.text: Argo sighs and slumps back, pulling a small canteen from his belt and taking a sip. "Not long ago, I was in nothing but the highest graces of the Theocracy. My father sat at the table of victors when the Elders divided the Rock-Crystal Empire and seized power, but he was denied a place as an Elder. He warned me that the Elders would not be kind to our heritage unless we continued to prove our loyalty. I served as a Chrysolic priest for many years before I married my wife, Iri. Together we had two children, a son and a daughter."

"We both knew that neither of their lives would be easy, but we tried as hard as possible to place them in positions of security. Our son was sent to the Inquisition to be trained as a Crusader, while our daughter was promised a hand in marriage with Toarde, the head Elder. She was but a young child at the time, but what were we to do? The Rock people hated us, they saw us as exactly what we were. My daughter hated me too, and one day she simply vanished from her room in Toarde's palace along with her brother. Toarde was furious, and he blamed me because he had no one else to blame."

"I was exiled from the Theocracy and abandoned by my wife, who chose to pledge herself to Toarde instead. With nowhere to go I traveled to the Badlands, where I found Turban. The outcasts who lived here hated me, but I was able to survive by proving my usefulness as a guide through the unexplored halls of the buildings. I had helped in the planning for the original construction of Turban before it was abandoned, you see. After the outcasts had established full control I was allowed to stay, but they began to call me the 'cursed one'. A homeless prophet who wandered the streets claimed that I would bring destruction to this place. And... well, here we are I suppose."
Argo falls silent, staring at the floor. He sheathes his canteen and the room turns silent once again.

event.name: TURBAN_BOMBING_COALITION
event.text: There is a palpable feeling of unease in the room, but every attempt to break the tension goes nowhere. Through the silence you can hear the distant thuds and feel the violent shaking as the bombardment of the city above continues without relent. At this rate, nothing will be left. Hours pass, and you're certain the fleet is making progress on your location. Several times footsteps can be heard outside the room, but no one ever enters.

Argo begins to hum a tune, some old Rock folk-song, but he's interrupted by an announcement over an old radio in the corner of the room. "Attention all those who remain: return to the surface at once and surrender yourselves. Those who have taken refuge in the sewers or ravines will be quickly snuffed out." You remotely check your ship's radar and see a concerningly large new blip appear. Seems the Theocracy has deployed a cruiser vessel of some kind.

It seems, despite the silence, that the room has unanimously decided to stand together. As the Theocracy search parties draw near, the door to the room is violently torn from its unstable hinges and you soon find your face on the floor with a gun to your head. Barely any sort of fight is put up as the Theocracy outnumbers your group by almost another 10 soldiers. You're drawn out to the surface, where you find the city is now little more than rubble.

The Theocracy team transporting the group splits you and your crew off from the others, handing you over to the Coalition troops by the side. During the transfer however, Argo breaks free from his restraints and takes down one of the Crusaders. In the panic, your crew escape and make it back to your ship while the survivors draw arms and battle against the Theocracy ground troops. You trust them to hold their own this time, but they won't stand a chance unless you can take down that cruiser! Not like you have a choice, because it's already locked onto your vessel and is approaching fast.

choice.text: Try to escape through the sewers.

event.text: You and your crew take off through the sewers, trying to avoid capture. There's a few very close calls but you manage to make it back to your ship and slip away without anyone noticing. You know you should feel guilty, but you can't risk your primary mission.

event.name: TURBAN_BOMBING_COALITION_WIN
event.text: The Coalition Cruiser has been defeated. There's little reason to worry about the wreckage hitting anything - Turban's already at its worst.

It seems the Theocracy's mission is complete, even if some survived. Most of the ships have jumped away, and visibly the survivors managed to scrape through the fire-fight. Among them is Argo, carrying a bloodied staff typically carried by priests such as he used to be. "I am in no way qualified to speak in such manners, but I think it goes without saying we people of Turban thank you. We Outcasts never expected the Federation to aid us in such a way. Assuming it has survived the bombardment, you should find a Rock cruiser on the landing pads outside of the city. It belongs to me, but I want you to have it. I must stay here and help repair the city. Turban will stand once again, I am certain of it."
